result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin R Spicer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 07/22/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by the court. Defense request for a No Violent Contact Order is denied by the court.

- Complete Batterer's Intervention program, if needed.
- Mental health evaluatin; take all prescribed medications, if needed.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment, if needed.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- No Contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

timeConds.notes:
07-22-16/ Judge Jeffrey Kremers
The defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 3 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melvin R Spicer

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
reflects 07-22-16 Court order imposing 3 days of condition time.
letter to court from Theresa Spicer.
Probation Review Hearing on September 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab  
DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 091616 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36..  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Judge Kremers has agreed to hear this case for Judge Protasiewicz, who is in trial.
As to count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
As to count 2:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
NO CONDITION TIME SET.
- Complete batterer's intervention program, if needed.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications, if needed.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment, if needed.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  Defense request for a no violent contact order is denied by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Case spun to branch 36. Files forwarded.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State requests adjournment due to witness unavailability. Defense requests case dismissed. Court grants state request and denies defense request. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial in branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. First call- parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar. Second call- Appearances remain the same. Parties ready to proceed. Case passed to 1:30 pm in branch 24.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 3/16/16 in Branch 24.
Received and Filed, Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed, Demand for Discovery.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TMS dob 7/10/69

Defendant Melvin R Spicer in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Melvin R Spicer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
